alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Fulton; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 9:53AM EST until March 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Indiana... Auglaize River near Fort Jennings affecting Allen OH, Paulding and Putnam Counties. Maumee River at Fort Wayne affecting Allen IN and Paulding Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Allen IN, De Kalb and Defiance Counties. Saint Marys River near Decatur affecting Adams, Allen IN and Van Wert Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Williams, Defiance and Fulton OH Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Maumee River near Defiance affecting Henry and Defiance Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Ohio... Blanchard River at Ottawa affecting Putnam County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tiffin River at Stryker. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters begin to affect some farm buildings near Stryker and flood some secondary roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EST Monday was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday afternoon and continue falling to 10.3 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
